ui.panel.config.introduction: In this view it is possible to configure your components and Home Assistant. Not everything is possible to configure from the UI yet, but we're working on it.
ui.panel.config.advanced_mode.hint_enabl: Missing config options? Enable advanced mode on
ui.panel.config.common.editor.confirm_un: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to leave?
ui.panel.config.areas.caption: Areas
ui.panel.config.areas.description: Group devices and entities into areas
ui.panel.config.areas.picker.introductio: Areas are used to organize where devices are. This information will be used throughout Home Assistant to help you in organizing your interface, permissions and integrations with other systems.
To place devices in an area, use the link below to navigate to the integrations page and then click on a configured integration to get to the device cards.
ui.panel.config.areas.picker.no_areas: Looks like you have no areas yet!
ui.panel.config.areas.editor.name: Name
ui.panel.config.areas.editor.no_linked_e: There are no entities linked to this area.
ui.panel.config.areas.delete.confirmatio: Are you sure you want to delete this area?
All devices in this area will become unassigned.
ui.panel.config.tag.caption: Tags
ui.panel.config.tag.description: Trigger automations when a NFC tag, QR code, etc. is scanned
ui.panel.config.tag.confirm_remove: Are you sure you want to remove tag {tag}?
ui.panel.config.tag.headers.name: Name
ui.panel.config.tag.detail.name: Name
ui.panel.config.tag.detail.usage: A tag can trigger an automation when scanned, you can use NFC tags, QR codes or any other kind of tag. Use our {companion_link} to write this tag to a programmable NFC tag or create a QR code below.
ui.panel.config.energy.caption: Energy
ui.panel.config.energy.description: Monitor your energy production and consumption
ui.panel.config.energy.grid.title: Electricity grid
ui.panel.config.energy.grid.sub: Configure the amount of energy that you consume from the grid and, if you produce energy, give back to the grid. This allows Home Assistant to track your whole home energy usage.
ui.panel.config.energy.grid.learn_more: More information on how to get started.
Grid consumption is the energy that flows from the energy grid to your home.
Select how Home Assistant should keep track of the costs of the consumed energy.
Use an entity tracking the total costs
Use an entity with current price
Grid production is the energy that flows from your solar panels to the grid.
Do you get money back when you return energy to the grid?
I do not get money back
Use an entity tracking the total recieved money
Use an entity with current rate
ui.panel.config.energy.solar.title: Solar Panels
ui.panel.config.energy.solar.sub: Let Home Assistant monitor your solar panels and give you insight on their performance.
ui.panel.config.energy.solar.learn_more: More information on how to get started.
ui.panel.config.energy.solar.stat_return: Solar energy returned to the grid
ui.panel.config.energy.solar.stat_predic: Prediction of your solar energy production
ui.panel.config.energy.battery.title: Home Battery Storage
ui.panel.config.energy.battery.sub: If you have a battery system, you can configure it to monitor how much energy was stored and used from your battery.
ui.panel.config.energy.battery.learn_mor: More information on how to get started.
ui.panel.config.energy.gas.title: Gas Consumption
ui.panel.config.energy.gas.sub: Let Home Assistant monitor your gas usage.
ui.panel.config.energy.gas.learn_more: More information on how to get started.
ui.panel.config.energy.gas.dialog.paragr: Gas consumption is the volume of gas that flows to your home.
ui.panel.config.energy.gas.dialog.cost_p: Select how Home Assistant should keep track of the costs of the consumed energy.
ui.panel.config.energy.gas.dialog.cost_s: Use an entity tracking the total costs
ui.panel.config.energy.gas.dialog.cost_e: Use an entity with current price
ui.panel.config.energy.device_consumptio: Tracking the energy usage of individual devices allows Home Assistant to break down your energy usage by device.
More information on how to get started.
Pick entity to track energy of
Select the entity that represents the device energy usage.

ui.panel.config.customize.warning.includ: It seems that your configuration.yaml doesn't properly

ui.panel.config.cloud.description_featur: Control home when away and integrate with Alexa and Google Assistant
ui.panel.config.cloud.login.title: Cloud Login
ui.panel.config.cloud.login.introduction: Home Assistant Cloud provides you with a secure remote connection to your instance while away from home. It also allows you to connect with cloud-only services: Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant.
This service is run by our partner
, a company founded by the founders of Home Assistant and Hass.io.
Home Assistant Cloud is a subscription service with a free one month trial. No payment information necessary.
ui.panel.config.cloud.login.learn_more_l: Learn more about Home Assistant Cloud
ui.panel.config.cloud.login.alert_passwo: You need to change your password before logging in.
ui.panel.config.cloud.login.alert_email_: You need to confirm your email before logging in.
ui.panel.config.cloud.forgot_password.in: Enter your email address and we will send you a link to reset your password.
ui.panel.config.cloud.forgot_password.ch: Check your email for instructions on how to reset your password.
ui.panel.config.cloud.register.title: Register Account
ui.panel.config.cloud.register.headline: Start your free trial
ui.panel.config.cloud.register.informati: Create an account to start your free one month trial with Home Assistant Cloud. No payment information necessary.
The trial will give you access to all the benefits of Home Assistant Cloud, including:
ui.panel.config.cloud.register.feature_r: Control of Home Assistant away from home
ui.panel.config.cloud.register.feature_w: Easy integration with webhook-based apps like OwnTracks
ui.panel.config.cloud.register.informati: This service is run by our partner
, a company founded by the founders of Home Assistant and Hass.io.
By registering an account you agree to the following terms and conditions.
ui.panel.config.cloud.register.account_c: Account created! Check your email for instructions on how to activate your account.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.thank_you_: Thank you for being part of Home Assistant Cloud. It's because of people like you that we are able to make a great home automation experience for everyone. Thank you!
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.integratio: Integrations for Home Assistant Cloud allow you to connect with services in the cloud without having to expose your Home Assistant instance publicly on the internet.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.tts.title: Text to Speech
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.tts.info: Bring personality to your home by having it speak to you by using our Text-to-Speech services. You can use this in automations and scripts by using the {service} service.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.tts.dialog: Hello {name}, you can play any text on any supported media player!
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.remote.acc: Remote control is being prepared. We will notify you when it's ready.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.remote.inf: Home Assistant Cloud provides a secure remote connection to your instance while away from home.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.remote.ins: Your instance will be available at
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.remote.rem: Enable this option to make sure that your Home Assistant instance is always remotely accessible.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.alexa.info: With the Alexa integration for Home Assistant Cloud you'll be able to control all your Home Assistant devices via any Alexa-enabled device.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.alexa.enab: Enable the Home Assistant skill for Alexa
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.alexa.info: If you enable state reporting, Home Assistant will send all state changes of exposed entities to Amazon. This allows you to always see the latest states in the Alexa app and use the state changes to create routines.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.google.inf: With the Google Assistant integration for Home Assistant Cloud you'll be able to control all your Home Assistant devices via any Google Assistant-enabled device.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.google.ena: Activate the Home Assistant Cloud skill for Google Assistant
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.google.inf: If you enable state reporting, Home Assistant will send all state changes of exposed entities to Google. This allows you to always see the latest states in the Google app.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.google.ent: Please enter a PIN to interact with security devices. Security devices are doors, garage doors and locks. You will be asked to say/enter this PIN when interacting with such devices via Google Assistant.
Enter a PIN to use security devices
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.google.syn: Failed to sync your entities to Google, ask Google 'Hey Google, sync my devices' to sync your entities.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.google.not: Before you can use Google Assistant, you need to activate the Home Assistant Cloud skill for Google Assistant in the Google Home app.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.webhooks.i: Anything that is configured to be triggered by a webhook can be given a publicly accessible URL to allow you to send data back to Home Assistant from anywhere, without exposing your instance to the internet.
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.webhooks.n: Looks like you have no webhooks yet. Get started by configuring a
ui.panel.config.cloud.account.webhooks.l: Learn more about creating webhook-powered automations.

ui.panel.config.entities.caption: Entities
ui.panel.config.entities.picker.introduc: Home Assistant keeps a registry of every entity it has ever seen that can be uniquely identified. Each of these entities will have an entity ID assigned which will be reserved for just this entity.
Use the entity registry to override the name, change the entity ID or remove the entry from Home Assistant.
ui.panel.config.entities.picker.enable_s: This will make them available in Home Assistant again if they are now disabled.
ui.panel.config.entities.picker.disable_: Disabled entities will not be added to Home Assistant.
ui.panel.config.entities.picker.remove_s: You should remove them from your Lovelace config and automations if they contain these entities.

You can only remove {removable} of the selected {selected} entities. Entities can only be removed when the integration is no longer providing the entities. Sometimes you have to restart Home Assistant before you can remove the entities of a removed integration. Are you sure you want to remove the removable entities?

ui.panel.config.person.description: Manage the people that Home Assistant tracks

ui.panel.config.zone.caption: Zones
ui.panel.config.zone.description: Manage the zones you want to track people in
ui.panel.config.zone.introduction: Zones allow you to specify certain regions on earth. When a person is within a zone, the state will take the name from the zone. Zones can also be used as a trigger or condition inside automation setups.

ui.panel.config.zone.edit_home_zone: The radius of the Home zone can't be edited from the frontend yet. Drag the marker on the map to move the home zone.
ui.panel.config.zone.edit_home_zone_narr: The radius of the Home zone can't be edited from the frontend yet. The location can be changed from the general configuration.
ui.panel.config.zone.home_zone_core_conf: The location of your home zone is editable from the general configuration page. The radius of the Home zone can't be edited from the frontend yet. Do you want to go to the general configuration?

ui.panel.config.zone.detail.passive_note: Passive zones are hidden in the frontend and are not used as location for device trackers. This is useful if you just want to use it for automations.

ui.panel.config.ozw.select_instance.head: Select an OpenZWave Instance
ui.panel.config.ozw.select_instance.intr: You have more than one OpenZWave instance running. Which instance would you like to manage?
ui.panel.config.ozw.select_instance.none: We couldn't find an OpenZWave instance. If you believe this is incorrect, check your OpenZWave and MQTT setups and ensure that Home Assistant can communicate with your MQTT broker.
ui.panel.config.ozw.node_config.introduc: Manage the different configuration parameters for a Z-Wave node.
ui.panel.config.ozw.node_config.help_sou: Config parameter descriptions and help text are provided by the OpenZWave project.
ui.panel.config.ozw.node_config.wakeup_h: Battery powered nodes must be awake to change their configuration. If the node is not awake, OpenZWave will attempt to update the node's configuration the next time it wakes up, which could be multiple hours (or days) later. Follow these steps to wake up your device:
ui.panel.config.zha.add_device_page.pair: Make sure your devices are in pairing mode. Check the instructions of your device on how to do this.
ui.panel.config.zha.add_device_page.disc: Devices will show up here once discovered.
ui.panel.config.zha.add_device_page.no_d: No devices were found, make sure they are in pairing mode and keep them awake while discovering is running.
ui.panel.config.zha.clusters.help_cluste: Select a cluster to view attributes and commands.
ui.panel.config.zha.clusters.introductio: Clusters are the building blocks for Zigbee functionality. They separate functionality into logical units. There are client and server types and that are comprised of attributes and commands.
ui.panel.config.zha.cluster_attributes.h: Select an attribute to view or set its value.
Get the value for the selected attribute.
Set attribute value for the specified cluster on the specified entity.
ui.panel.config.zha.cluster_commands.hel: Select a command to interact with.
The device is ready to use
ui.panel.config.zha.network.caption: Network
ui.panel.config.zha.groups.caption: Groups
ui.panel.config.zha.groups.group_details: Here are all the details for the selected Zigbee group.
ui.panel.config.zha.groups.create_group_: Enter the required details to create a new zigbee group
ui.panel.config.zha.group_binding.group_: Select a group to issue a bind command.
ui.panel.config.zha.group_binding.cluste: Select clusters to bind to the selected group.
ui.panel.config.zha.group_binding.bind_b: Bind the selected group to the selected device clusters.
ui.panel.config.zha.group_binding.unbind: Unbind the selected group from the selected device clusters.
ui.panel.config.zwave.migration.ozw.head: Migrate to OpenZWave
ui.panel.config.zwave.migration.ozw.intr: This wizard will help you migrate from the legacy Z-Wave integration to the OpenZWave integration that is currently in beta.
ui.panel.config.zwave.network_management: Run commands that affect the Z-Wave network. You won't get feedback on whether most commands succeeded, but you can check the OZW Log to try to find out.
ui.panel.config.zwave.node_management.in: Run Z-Wave commands that affect a single node. Pick a node to see a list of available commands.
ui.panel.config.zwave.node_management.no: Select node to view per-node options
ui.panel.config.zwave.node_management.ex: Exclude this entity from Home Assistant
ui.panel.config.zwave.ozw_log.introducti: View the log. 0 is the minimum (loads entire log) and 1000 is the maximum. Load will show a static log and tail will auto update with the last specified number of lines of the log.
ui.panel.config.zwave.network_status.net: This may take a while depending on the size of your network.
Awake nodes have been queried. Sleeping nodes will be queried when they wake.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.dashboard.intro: Manage your Z-Wave network and Z-Wave nodes
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.dashboard.dump_: Download a dump of your network to help diagnose issues
Some of your nodes are dead
Some of your nodes didn't respond and are assumed dead. These will not be fully exported.
Not all nodes are ready yet
If you create an export while not all nodes are ready, you could miss needed data. Give your network some time to query all nodes. Do you want to continue with the dump?
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.node_config.int: Manage and adjust device (node) specific configuration parameters for the selected device
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.node_config.att: Device configuration parameters and descriptions are provided by the {device_database}
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.node_config.bat: Battery devices must be awake to update their config. Please refer to your device manual for instructions on how to wake the device.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.node_config.set: The parameter change has been queued, and will be updated when the device wakes up.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.add_node.title: Add a Z-Wave Node
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.add_node.introd: This wizard will guide you through adding a node to your Z-Wave network.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.add_node.secure: Secure devices require additional bandwidth; too many secure devices can slow down your Z-Wave network. We recommend only using secure inclusion for devices that require it, like locks or garage door openers.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.add_node.contro: Your Z-Wave controller is now in inclusion mode.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.add_node.follow: Follow the directions that came with your device to trigger pairing on the device.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.add_node.inclus: The node could not be added. Please check the logs for more information.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.add_node.interv: The device is being interviewed. This may take some time.
The device interview failed. Additional information may be available in the logs.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.remove_node.int: Remove a node from your Z-Wave network, and remove the associated device and entities from Home Assistant.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.remove_node.con: Your Z-Wave controller is now in exclusion mode.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.remove_node.fol: Follow the directions that came with your device to trigger exclusion on the device.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.remove_node.exc: The node could not be removed. Please check the logs for more information.
Node {id} has been removed from your Z-Wave network.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.remove_failed_n: Remove a failed device from your Z-Wave network. Use this if you are unable to exclude a device normally because it is broken.
The device removal is in progress.
Node {id} has been removed from your Z-Wave network.
The device could not be removed from your Z-Wave network.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.reinterview_nod: Re-interview a device on your Z-Wave network. Use this feature if your device has missing or incorrect functionality.
You will need to wake battery powered devices before starting the re-interview. Refer to your device's manual for instructions on how to wake the device.
You can close this dialog and the interview will continue in the background.
The device is being interviewed. This may take some time.
The device interview failed. Additional information may be available in the logs.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_network.in: Start a network heal on your Z-Wave network. A network heal will cause all devices to re-calculate their routes back to the controller and is recommended if you have recently moved devices or your controller.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_network.tr: The healing process generates a large amount of traffic on the Z-Wave network. This may cause devices to respond slowly (or not at all) while the heal is in progress.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_network.in: Network healing is in progress. This will take some time.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_network.ru: You can close this dialog and the network healing will continue in the background.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_network.he: Healing failed. Additional information may be available in the logs.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_node.title: Heal a Z-Wave Device
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_node.intro: Tell {device} to update its routes back to the controller. This can help with communication issues if you have recently moved the device or your controller.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_node.traff: The healing process generates a large amount of traffic on the Z-Wave network. This may cause devices to respond slowly (or not at all) while the heal is in progress.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_node.heali: Additional information may be available in the logs.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.heal_node.netwo: A Z-Wave network heal is already in progress. Please wait for it to finish before healing an individual device.
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.logs.title: Z-Wave JS Logs
ui.panel.config.zwave_js.logs.subscribed: Subscribed to Z-Wave JS Log Messages...
